Class Auction

  • java.lang.Object
    • Auction
  • public class Auction
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple model of an auction. The auction maintains a list of lots of arbitrary length. Modifications: SR: Added close method SR: Added getUnsold method SR: Modified getLot method SR: Added removeLot method
    Version:
    2019.08.01
    Author:
    David J. Barnes and Michael KÃ¶lling and Sharayah Reyes.

      • enterLot

        public void enterLot​(java.lang.String description)
        Enter a new lot into the auction.
        Parameters:
        description - A description of the lot.

      • showLots

        public void showLots()
        Show the full list of lots in this auction.

      • getUnsold

        public java.util.ArrayList<Lot> getUnsold()
        Return a list of the unsold lots

      • makeABid

        public void makeABid​(int lotNumber,
                     Person bidder,
                     long value)
        Make a bid for a lot. A message is printed indicating whether the bid is successful or not.
        Parameters:
        lotNumber - The lot being bid for.
        bidder - The person bidding for the lot.
        value - The value of the bid.

      • getLot

        public Lot getLot​(int lotNumber)
        Return the lot with the given number. Return null if a lot with this number does not exist.
        Parameters:
        lotNumber - The number of the lot to return.

      • close

        public void close()
        Prints out details of all lots and if lot has been sold or unsold. Also prints out name of winning bidder

      • removeLot

        public Lot removeLot​(int number)
        Remove the lot with the given ot number.
        Parameters:
        number - The number of the lot to be removed.
        Returns:
        The Lot with the given number, or null if there is no such lot.
